technologies.name: EMBODIED AI
technologies.description: We have several hybrid wetware systems that blend synthetic, digital, and biological life available on the market. The first commercial synthetic biological intelligence was the CL1 system which became available in March of 2025.

faq.question: What is embodied AI?
faq.answer: Embodied AI refers to artificial intelligence systems that have physical bodies and can interact with the world through sensors and actuators.

faq.question: Why does AGI need embodiment?
faq.answer: Physical embodiment allows AI to develop true understanding of the world through direct experience and interaction.

articles.title: CL1: First Commercial Synthetic Biological Intelligence
articles.excerpt: The CL1 system represents a breakthrough in synthetic biological intelligence, combining digital and biological components in a commercially available package.

technologies.name: BRAIN COMPUTER INTERFACE
technologies.description:
Humans have developed several ways to interface multiple conscious and unconscious minds together. Recently scientists developed a way for one "sender" to transmit motor signals to one "receiver" and other scientists discovered a manner of transmitting information through lucid dreams.

Neuralink and similar devices are expected to provide significant gains in many fields such as neuroscience. However, significant ethical concerns as well as concerns surrounding inequality need careful discussion and consideration by the public and policy makers.

Lightweight Augmented Reality devices are being made with many years of AI-enhanced producitivity gains expected in the hardware and software of devices like Meta's smart glasses and other, similar headwear devices.

Many of these devices use technology that has been patented and approved to receive brain wave data during use. The opportunities for scientific understanding, personal privacy invasion, and the creation of entierely unpredictable social disparities cannot be overstated.

faq.question: What is a neural interface?
faq.answer: A neural interface is a direct communication pathway between the human brain and external devices, allowing for bidirectional information transfer.

faq.question: What are the ethical concerns?
faq.answer: Key concerns include privacy invasion, social inequality, and the potential for misuse of brain data. These issues require careful consideration and regulation.

articles.title: Breakthrough in Brain-to-Brain Communication
articles.excerpt: Scientists have successfully demonstrated direct motor signal transmission between human brains, marking a significant step forward in neural interfaces.

articles.title: Meta's Brain-Reading Smart Glasses
articles.excerpt: Meta's latest smart glasses incorporate approved brain wave reading technology, raising concerns about privacy and data collection.

technologies.name: Quantum Computing
technologies.description: Practical quantum computing with sufficient qubits and error correction
technologies.impact: Provides the computational power needed for complex AGI models and simulations

faq.question: What is quantum computing?
faq.answer: Quantum computing uses quantum-mechanical phenomena to perform calculations that would be impossible for classical computers.

faq.question: How does it help with AGI?
faq.answer: Quantum computing provides the massive computational power needed to run complex AGI models and simulations of consciousness.

technologies.name: Consciousness Model
technologies.description: Scientific understanding and model of human consciousness
technologies.impact: Enables creation of truly conscious AI systems by understanding the nature of consciousness

faq.question: What is consciousness?
faq.answer: Consciousness is the state of being aware of and able to think about oneself, one's surroundings, and one's experiences.

faq.question: Why is it important for AGI?
faq.answer: Understanding consciousness is crucial for creating AI systems that are truly self-aware and capable of genuine understanding.

technologies.name: Self-Improvement System
technologies.description: AI system capable of improving its own architecture and capabilities
technologies.impact: Enables AI to evolve and improve beyond human capabilities

faq.question: What is self-improving AI?
faq.answer: Self-improving AI systems can modify their own architecture and capabilities to become more capable over time.

faq.question: Is it safe?
faq.answer: Safety measures and alignment research are crucial to ensure self-improving AI remains aligned with human values.

neuroscience.description: Understanding of human brain and consciousness
